author: nero_eth
content: You mean "at the latest at the attestation deadline", right?

author: potuz
content: Yeah the honest builder spec should say that the builder should reveal the Payload when it sees a block with his bid, but a builder can only guarantee it won't be unbundled (with same guarantees as today) if they reveal after the attestation deadline. So honest builders should reveal at the attestation deadline. Any other behavior is playing games

author: nero_eth
content: If builders want the same guarantees as today, they can directly release right after seeing the beacon block. Every ms they wait for attestations to come in adds additional unbundling safety that they don't have today.

author: potuz
content: No if they release after seeing the block they can be unbundled with an equivocatiom without the collusion of the next proposer. If they release after the attestation deadline they are guaranteed as today that the only way to be unbundled is not only an equivocation but also the next proposer needs to help

author: potuz
content: But sure, if they are sophisticated enough and count attestations they can get this guarantee before the attestation deadline

author: potuz
content: The point I'm making is that they should never need to release after the attestation deadline

author: nero_eth
content: Yeah but same as today. When you sign the header and the relay propagates the block, you can unbundle it, equivocate and try to win the race. Unrealistic scenario but yeah, there's no real protection.

author: nero_eth
content: Same-slot unbundling can happen today (has happened once and actors went to jail for it) but under ePBS you _can_ avoid it. It would eat into valuable propagation time if they had to wait.

author: potuz
content: Today you can unbundle trivially without any race when you hold two consecutive blocks though

author: potuz
content: Actually I wonder what builders thought about this

author: fradamt
content: If you see the block, wait a bit to listen for equivocations and then release, it can't be unbundled anymore, because the block has had time to diffuse and an equivocation wouldn't do anything at that point. Attestation counting isn't necessarily needed

author: terencechain
content: Side note: prysm validators will attest timely by default in the next releaes, that means all the clients will do this, before was only prysm I think. There's 0 reason to withhold until attestation deadline, 60%+ of attestation should arrive before 4s mark by my accounting

author: potuz
content: If the next proposer is colluding it can always build on top of the equivocation and clients will request the parent

author: potuz
content: I think this unbundling is not prevented neither by MEV boost nor ePBS

author: potuz
content: The original form of ePBS with block slot was designed to prevent even this form of unbundling

author: potuz
content: But we ditched that forkchoice now
